content: आर्ष {%<ab>a.</ab>%} (र्षी|{%<ab>f.</ab>%}) [ऋषेरिदं अण्] {@--1@} Used by a Ṛṣi only, relating or belonging to sages, archaic, Vedic (<ab>opp.</ab> लौकिक or classical); आर्षःप्रयोगः; संबुद्धौ शाकल्यस्येतावनार्षे <ls>Sk.</ls>; आर्षो धर्मः <ls>Ms. 3. 29</ls>; <ls>Y. 1. 59</ls>; आर्षः प्रत्ययः <ls>P. II. 4. 58</ls>. {@--2@} Sacred, holy, divine, superhuman; <ls>U. 6.</ls> --र्षः A form of marriage derived from the Ṛṣis; one of the eight forms of marriage in which the father of the bride receives one or two pairs of cows from the bride-groom; आदायार्षस्तु गोद्वयम् <ls>Y. 1. 59</ls>; <ls>Ms. 3. 53</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">9. 196</ls>; for the names of the {8} forms see उद्वाह; आर्षोढा a wife married according to this form. --र्षा A class of Vedic metres. --र्षं {@--1@} The holy text, the Vedas. {@--2@} Sacred descent. {@--3@} Derivation (of a poem) from a Ṛṣi author.
